alert.note: Alert for Bryan (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 7:31AM CST until March 10 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... Blue River near Blue affecting Bryan County.
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. OKC013-100145- /O.NEW.KOUN.FL.Y.0005.230309T1331Z-230310T1800Z/ /BLUO2.N.ER.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.000000T0000Z.NO/ 731 AM CST Thu Mar 9 2023 ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Blue River near Blue. * WHEN...From this morning to early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, The river remains largely within its banks... throughout Bryan County. Inflows from local streams could cause minor overflows to reach very low fields for a short while. Only farmlands are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM CST Thursday the stage was 22.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 27.0 feet this evening. It will then fall to 6.8 feet early Monday afternoon. It will rise to 7.0 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Action stage is 26.0 feet. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
